summary: The bill, the Community Mental Wellness and Resilience Act of 2025, amends the Public Health Service Act to establish a grant program focused on community mental wellness and resilience. It directs the Secretary of Health and Human Services to award grants to eligible organizations for planning and program implementation. These programs aim to promote mental wellness and resilience through evidence-based, community-driven initiatives, including identifying and addressing risk factors, building community capacity, and developing strategic plans. The bill also defines key terms and authorizes appropriations for the program.
